instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message:
Hey,

I'm working on a 820-00165 that is struggeling turning on. I have to trigger SMC_ONNOFF_L several times until it powers on (same in SMC bypass mode).
When I'm lucky and it turns on I have no USB acticity and no display. 
CPU Vcore is present (1.7V).
PPBUS_G3H: 8.6V
SYS_PWORK_R: 3.42V
CPU_VR_READY: 1.02V
PLT_RESET_L: 0V.

threads.title: 820-00165 powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message: already tried a known working BIOS and replaced U6100

threads.title: 820-00165 powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message:
PLT_RESET_L must go high first.
Check CPU_VCCST_PWRGD, PM_PCH_PWROK and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK.

threads.title: 820-00165 powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message:
CPU_VCCST_PWRGD: 1.02V
PM_PCH_PWROK: 3.42V
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK: 3.42V

How exactly the board behaves (LCD connected only):
Fan starts spinning, board is taking~250mA, fanstarts to run faster for a mement, then amperage drop back to 25mA. After few seconds it powers on again, running on 300mA.
But I can't detect any voltage on  PLT_RESET_L   - not even a single spike.

threads.title: 820-00165 powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message: Looks like PCH issue; possibly crap accumulated underneath.

threads.title: 820-00165 powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message: Heating PCH with flux didnt't helped. Sometimes I'm getting PLT_RESET_L but there is still no USB activity if it is present

threads.title: 820-00165 powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message: I found out the board is turning off every time i try to measure voltage on CPU_VR_PGOOD_R. What could cause this behavior?

threads.title: 820-00165 powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message:
Very likely PCH internal issue.
Any history fault available?

threads.title: 820-00165 powers on but no USB activity and no POST
threads.message:
dudipupan check this shiz out: [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/820-00165-cpu-heats-up-draws-35a.60817/[/URL]

I think we had basically the same issue after all power signals were good.  Missing PLT_RESET_L so the PCH/CPU was in constant reset.
